Key Match Events: Brandon King wins the Player of the Match award for his outstanding knock.
West Indies chased down 180 in 19.1 overs with Brandon King and Evin Lewis hitting half-centuries.
Rovman Powell won the toss and elected to bowl first.
Kamindu Mendis and Charith Asalanka stitched a 82-run stand to build a solid base for the death overs.
Bhanuka Rajapaksa and Maheesh Theekshana applied the finishing touches to get a competitive total.
West Indies needed just a couple of good knocks from Powell, Chase, and Rutherford to secure victory.
Sherfane Rutherford finished things off in style with a boundary over mid-off in the final over.
Pre-Game Insights: West Indies captain Rovman Powell won the toss and opted to bowl first.
Sri Lanka captain Charith Asalanka said he would have bowled first as well.
Post-Match Reflections: Sri Lanka were superb in the death overs but could not take early wickets to control the game.
West Indies managed to take a 1-0 lead in the three-match series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Brandon King wins the Player of the Match award.
West Indies needed just a couple of good knocks to secure victory.
